ygData.subject: RE: Hey this sounded interesting..
ygData.msgSnippet: Arrrrrggghhh.  This is extremely frustrating.  Hybrids of what?!?! Enough of this, this topic is no longer about bards, but about shamans/druid/clerics. I
ygData.messageBody:
Arrrrrggghhh. This is extremely frustrating. Hybrids of what?!?!
Enough of this, this topic is no longer about bards, but about
shamans/druid/clerics.
I can't stand it any more.


Elwyn

-----Original Message-----
From: Lange, Stephen [mailto:SLANGE@...]
Sent: Friday, October 01, 1999 10:09 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hey this sounded interesting..


From: "Lange, Stephen" <SLANGE@...>

IMO Shamans are hybrids.

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:Dean_Kimes@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 30, 1999 4:46 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hey this sounded interesting..


From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>

Shamans can wear the same armor Rangers can, does this mean Shamans are
hybrids or Rangers are not?

-----Original Message-----
From: Lange, Stephen [mailto:SLANGE@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 30, 1999 3:00 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hey this sounded interesting..


From: "Lange, Stephen" <SLANGE@...>

>They are not hybrids, they are the priest classes.

A hybrid is considered any class that can use slashing weapons or armor.
Druids and Shaman can. Pure Casters cannot. Ask yourself, does the Druid
or Shaman follow the same weapon/armor rules as a Pure Caster (Mage/Wizard).
Clerics are the oddball, in that they can wear armor.
